Title: Has anyone ever checked for a correlation between paranormal activity and mood disorders ?
Question: Mood disorders being bipolar, schizoaffective disorders, etc.
Answer: If they haven't that would be a good thing to research.
I don't think it would give you the outcome you might be thinking of though.  Maybe other disorders.

My aunt is bipolar and is not particularly interested in ghosts, aliens or anything like that.  She is slightly excessively religious, but that's all.

My brother is mildly autistic (not really a traditional mood disorder) and he used to have a strong interest in UFOs when he was little but has made no claims of seeing any, or any ghosts, and no longer seems to be very obsessed with them.

I am also mildly schizoaffective (and very obsessive compulsive) but do not suffer from hallucinations.  I assume that one who did would likely include aliens or ghosts or goblins (whatever) although I haven't heard of most people expiriencing this.

I am extremely irrational though at times and half to self-council myself to look at things logically, although sometimes I allow some delusions (typically involving ghosts) to stay unanalyzed.  I think my interest in science has actually helped me to not be more delusional than I am.

label: Education & Reference
sentence:
Question: Why are the applications for student aid so complicated, and why isn't there more help?
Answer: There is really one main application that is a "must do" when applying for financial aid -- the FAFSA.  If you only complete this single application you are automatically reviewed for virtually every financial aid package available to US students.  Pell Grant is also obtainable as a piggy back off the FAFSA application.  

You can complete the app online at no cost to you -- watch out for sites that try and charge you ... there is no reason you should have to pay.  You can obtain a pin number as well allowing you to communicate about your application strictly via the web.

Best of luck to you

label: Society & Culture
sentence:
Question: I go to boarding school , I haven't made many friends, I can be a day student, what should I do?
Answer: I think the people who are advising you to join school clubs might be right. Most of the clubs do their recruiting either at the beginning or the end of the semester. See if there are any clubs that are doing anything that you might remotely be interested in. If you know someone who's in a club, asking about the club's activities might be a way to start a friendly conversation. 

There are also the usual extra-curricular activities and sports available. When I went off to school, I joined the band and enjoyed it...I got good at it, and ended up going to college for free on music scholarships, so getting involved in an activity can actually be beneficial in more ways than you initially realize. 

If there are any opportunities to volunteer around the school, do so. I still use this tactic from time to time when I'm in a new situation and need to meet people. While doing the volunteer activity, you can make small talk with whoever's standing next to you, even if it's something goofy like, "Hey, I like that shirt you're wearing." (However, clothing compliments can only go so far if you're at a school that uses uniforms). 

The only real answer is to get involved. Even if you're shy at first, you must get involved. If all else fails, just admit to a teacher that you're having a bit of a hard time adjusting socially. They'll usually be glad to help you hook up with some kind of activity.

label: Business & Finance

Question: where on line can I find when a small incorporated business was started?
Answer: if you google the name of the state in which you live along with the phrase "division of corporations", you should get some links to a state government site where you can look up the corporation by name. (if you don't know the exact corporate name, it will usually come up with a list of similar names, and you can probably pick out the one you're looking for).

It will usually list the date the business was incorporated (keep in mind that a business could have been in existence prior to actually incorporating, but the Div. of Corp. site should give you the date the business was officially incorporated).

It should also tell you if the corporation is still "active" or not. (Corporations must pay annual fees to the state in order to keep their status active).

Good luck

label: Science & Mathematics
sentence:
Title: Termination of pregnancy - potassium chloride injection?
Question: Based on the RCOG guidelines (Royal College of Obstetrics and Gynaecology), at what gestational age is the injection of potassium chloride into the fetal heart recommended prior to induction of labour?

I don't want any pro-choice, anti-abortion answers, I'm not pregnant, and I'm anti-abortion myself. But I'm a medical student with final exams in a few days, and I need to know - some places I've read 21 weeks, others 22 weeks.

Thanks for your help.
Answer: For all terminations at gestational age of more than 21 weeks and 6 days,the method chosen should ensure that the fetus is born dead.  Inter-cardiac potassium chloride is the recommended method and the dose chosen should ensure that the fetal asystole has been achieved.  It should be confirmed by observing the fetal heart by an ultrasound scan for 5 minutes.  Additionally it is mandatory to confirm asystole by ultrasound scan 30-60 minutes AFTER the procedure and definitely before the patient leaves the hospital.

Title: what is the differences between owner and creditor?
Question: tell me the differences between ownerand creditor.
Answer: These terms are mostly used in some banking segments:

Creditor means a person or entity who lends you money to purchase a thing on interest basis. 

Whereas the owner means a person or entity who provides you a thing on leasing basis or lends you money on profit and loss sharing basis against an agreement under which his benefits may not jeopardize even if you suffer with a loss.

label: Sports
sentence:
Title: what kinds of drills can i do to get better at basketball?
Question: thanks for your time
Answer: here r somethings u can do 2 become better.. 

Figure 8's - with dribble 
Spread legs dribble the ball in a figure eight motion around and between the legs. Do this with a lot of dribbles and then with as few as possible. Stay low! 


Drum dribble 
Either standing or on one knee have players dribble ball changing hands with each touch. Start with a steady dribble then work down to super fast low dribbles. then have them dribble with one finger on each hand and with their balled up fist. 

Keep your head up
When you dribble the ball, your intent is to go somewhere. Maybe you are dribbling up the court on a fast break, maybe you are dribbling to the wing as part of the offense, or maybe you are driving past the defender and to the basket. Whatever your goal and wherever you are going, you need to see the floor. Never dribble the ball with your head down, looking at the ball. By keeping your head up and seeing the floor, you can see where the defense is and what your next move might have to be. You can also see where your teammates are, who might be open, and what a good passing opportunity might be.

This is a great drill for getting used to dribbling with your head up so you can see the floor: simply start at one baseline and dribble full speed the full length of the court, keeping your head up at all times. DO NOT look down at the ball. Switch hands at half court. You can also try this drill with your eyes closed. But only dribble at half speed, and make sure to open your eyes after a few dribbles to make sure you aren't going to run into anything.


Be able to dribble with either hand
If you can only dribble effectively with your strong hand, you are very limited as an offensive threat. If I'm a defender, and I know you can only dribble to your right side, it will be very easy to guard you. But if you can drive to either your right or left, and have a good outside shot, then you're a real threat. Then I have to guard against a shot, and a drive to either side. Now you've got me guessing about what you might do next. Work on dribbling with both hands so that you don't have a weak dribbling hand. Work at it enough that you can dribble and drive to the baset equally well with either hand.

There are two ways to build your off-hand dribbling skills: one is simply to practice with your off hand. Make a point to do ONLY off hand dribbling drills for 15 or 20 mins a day for the next week. You'll be amazed at how much better your off hand will be in just that short amount of time.

Another amazing set of drills for developing your off hand are two-ball drills. Get two basketballs and start off at the baseline. Dribble both balls in a zig-zag pattern for the full length of the court, bouncing the balls at the same time. Once you reach the other end of the floor, do the same drill, but this time bounce the balls at different times (one ball hits the ground as the other ball comes up to your other hand, etc.). Remember, don't look down at the balls as you dribble. Do these drills for a few weeks and your off hand dribbling ability will be much improved.


BALL SLAP DRILL 
The ball slap drill is performed by taking the ball and with your left hand slap the ball hard, and then taking your right hand and slap the ball hard. This ball slap drill is a good way to warm your hands up and this will help you get a good feel for the ball. Continue performing the slap the ball dribbling drill until your hands are good, awake, and ready to begin. 


AROUND THE WORLD DRILL 
Basketball Dribbling Drill #2: The around the world basketball drill stats by circling the ball around your head, than your waist, and finally put your legs together and take the ball around both legs at the knees. Then, bend at the waist, spread your legs, and circle the ball around one leg, then the other. The around the world basketball drill will give you a great feel for the ball in addition to hand coordination and

label: Science & Mathematics
sentence:
Title: Modern Human Evolution?  How did all populations of humans advance at the same time?
Question: For approximately 150-200,000 years, humans essentially lived like very smart animals, then fairly suddenly, about 10,000 years ago, we all seemed to have discovered agriculture and "civilization"..a few thousand years later we were all writing.  I have never seen a decent, logical explanation for how all the populations of the Earth took this "great leap forward" at the same time-After 150-200,000 years, suddenly within about 1% of that time frame, there are cities everywhere from the Middle East, to China, to North and South America?  Writing starting independently everywhere?  For me, this is the most mysterious event in all of history-any ideas?
Answer: Hey! Your "other" question is already cluttered up with some high voltage discussion and nice arguements so, I thought I should post my answer here as it is more peaceful and calm here. I was wondering whether I should have posted my answer there? 

Now, I'll try to make sense while talking about a topic that I know little about. 

1- It all started with the arrival of the first bipedal- Australopithecus anamensis. (some might argue that it was Ardipithecus ramidus). Ok, the point is, as our ancestors started to learn to walk on two feet, they had some challenges to face as bipedalism reduced their speed considerably putting them at a clear disadvantage against their predators.
Now, as this problem was faced by all the hominids all over the world at the same time, it led to some parallel thoughts (and thus inventions and discoveries) all over the world e.g. building homes, making weapons and tools etc. (The stone tools were first made by the handy man i.e. Homo habilis and not Australopithecus).
This tool technology was spread by Homo ergaster as they  migrated outside Africa.

2- Then, in the course of evolution, the early humans started to have a complex cultural lives and they grew emotionally, e.g. the Neanderthals (who aren't our direct ancestors) started to bury the dead.

3- As the homo species like homo erectus, homo neanderthalis, homo heidelbergenesis and ancient homo sapiens (Cro Magnon) made further advances in creativity and productivity, they all felt a natural need to pen down their thoughts. This led to the cave painitngs and carvings. All of those paintings can be interpreted as diary entries as you may see that the paintings and carvings simply depict what the early men "did" i.e. hunting, using tools etc.
So, I guess it is understandable why the "pictorial-scripts" developed contemporarily to each other.

4- But the question still remains: Why were the origin of world's ancient scripts so contemporary to each other? I guess, as man found the pictorial depiction of thoughts and emotions more and more unconvenient and tedious due to the diverseness of thoughts and situations to be depicted, it started taking help of symbols. Perhaps, this behaviour was so "human-like" that every sub-species of the homo sapiens followed this pattern of 'depicting thoughts symbolically' universally.

5- Another reason of this might be migration. Before the ancient civilizations like Inka, Mesopotamia, Egyptian etc. even came into existence, the early hominids led a nomadic life. According to the "Out of Africa Hypothesis", all the modern humans "Homo Sapiens" originated from Africa. Later, they migrated to Africa, Asia and Europe and formed groups.
So, I guess due to their similar ancestral origins, the human beings had a common problem solving approach and hence, attempted the problem of inconvenience of pictorial scripts in a nearly identical manner.

The scientific difference in the scripts can explain that they were devised on completely different grounds but, the approach was similar due to common origins and creative grounds.

label: Health
sentence:
Title: HELP! i have a scratchy throat, my nose is stuffy and it has been this way for about three months?
Question: I have had a stuffy nose for about three months. i have been to the doctor butthe antibiotic medicine I was prescribed didn't clear my sinus.
I dont have any health insurance so I can not go to a allegry doctor because I can't afford it.
I need suggestions as to what I can do to help my sinuses and scratchy throat or  adoctor I can see forlow payments
Answer: You might just have allergies, but I'm sure the doctor must have considered that and told you to try Benadryl, Claritin, or Allegra at some point.

Antibiotics are appropriate if you have a bacterial sinusitis.  The particular bacteria might be resistant to whatever antibiotics they gave you.  You would need a culture of your snot to determine this.

Ultimately though, the problem probably started with poor sinus drainage.  Even with appropriate antibiotics, the problem will recur if the sinus drainage issue isn't resolved.  In the short term, Sudafed would probably help.  I don't like the idea of using Sudafed for more than a couple of weeks though.  If you have allergies exacerbating the situation (do you have a history of seasonal allergies, or any new pets?), then Benadryl or non-sedating Claritin would help.  For really bad cases, I know of a doctor that swears by the Neti pot (he uses it himself).  It's like a little watering pot for plants.  You fill it up with water or saline and pour it into your nose.  Basically you're physically cleaning out your sinus openings.

If there is a possibility you're allergic to something, I would try Claritin and the Neti pot first for 3 days and see if the symptoms improve.  If you don't think it's an allergy, try Sudafed + Neti pot.  If that doesn't do it, I would go back to the doctor and try another antibiotic together with the Sudafed + Neti pot.  VERY IMPORTANT: IF THE INFECTION SPREADS--YOUR CHEEK BECOMES RED AND PAINFUL OR IT HURTS TO MOVE AN EYE--GO STRAIGHT TO THE ER.  Sinusitis is normally just an inconvenience, not a serious health problem.  It can sometimes spread, however, and cause cellulitis in your cheek or an orbital abscess in your eye socket--both very serious conditions.

label: Health
sentence:
Title: When I have mensus, I have good flow 1 month and very little the next month. Can I conceive a healthy baby ?
Question: When I have my periods, I have a good flow in 1 month and very little the next month. Why is this so ? I have heard that each ovary produces the ovum each month. Is something wrong with 1 ovary ? Can I conceive a healthy baby ? Please help me.
Answer: Your question tells me that you know very little about how your own body works.  Maybe I can help with that.  Your ovaries alternate ovum production.  One month it's the right ovary, the next month it's the left one.  The menstrual flow is no indicator of whether or not you can conceive.  I have no idea why your flows changes from one period to the next.  It just happens that way.  And I have no idea if you can conceive a baby, healthy or otherwise. \n\nYou also ask "Is something wrong with 1 ovary?"  Why would you think that???  If you are so concerned about this, and frankly I have read nothing so far that should cause concern, then you should see a fertility specialist but I think you'd do better to see your gynecologist and direct these questions to her/him.

label: Education & Reference
sentence:
Title: what am i suppose to right for analysis, conclusion?
Question: it never sticks to my head....
Answer: Hi! 

I don't fully understand your question; I presume you're talking about an essay that you're writing. Generally, your "conclusion" is what you decide about an issue based on your "analysis" of the facts and other arguments.

So, the analysis part is very important. This is where you look at facts and evidence that support and that refute an issue or thesis. 

The analysis part is like you're a judge in a court room. You're hearing the evidence from the prosecution (against) about an issue and from the defence (for). You're judging the evidence. Some of it (regardless of sides) will be right, some of it will be wrong, and some of it will be irrelevant. Then from your evaluation of all the evidence, you decide (conclude) whether you agree or disagree with the issue.

I hope this helps!

Title: i have cramping in lower abdimen. and clamidia over a year ago can that still effect me?

Answer: Lower abdominal pain can be caused also by pelvic inflammatory disease (PID) caused by STD infections. One chlamydia infection may not have caused that but it isn't impossible. Question: what is the deeppest ocean in the world? in what country?
Answer: Pacific Ocean - The deepest known point on Earth is at the bottom of the Mariana Trench, a depression in the floor of the western Pacific Ocean, just east of the Mariana Islands. \n\nThe Mariana Trench is 1,554 miles long and averages 44 miles wide. Within it, about 210 miles southwest of Guam, lies the deepest known point on Earth. Named the “Challenger Deep” for the British survey ship Challenger II that located it in 1951, this underwater gorge plunges to a depth of nearly 7 miles! It is deeper than Mt. Everest is tall.

label: Business & Finance
sentence:
Title: Does it erase after 7 years?
Question: if i pay off all my debts that are in collections does it come off my credit report in 7 years? and does the 7 years start once debt is payed off or once you start paying on the debt?
Answer: Here is some information on an article I wrote back in December 2005

"How long will collection or other derogatory information stay on your credit report?"

Credit information can and usually stays on a person’s credit report for 7 years. You can use the information below as a reference to guide yourself and figure out how long derogatory information stays on your credit report

General credit information: 7yrs
Collections: 7yrs from date of last activity
Bankruptcy: 10 yrs
Foreclosure: 12 yrs from the date filed
Garnishment: 12 yrs from the date or entry or 7 yrs from the date satisfied
Judgment: 12 yrs from the date or entry or 7 yrs from the date satisfied
Tax lien: 12 yrs from the date or entry or 7 yrs from the date satisfied
Dismissed garnishments, judgments, and tax liens: not reportable

Now that you have this information I’ll give you an example similar to a client. The agent he had worked with before gave him the wrong advice.

Lets assume that you had a collection for $1,000 filed against you in December 1998 and you haven’t paid it. It’s now November 2005, so in a few weeks that collection can come off your credit report. (You will probably have to request all three credit bureaus to take it off your credit report). However, you just applied for a loan today and the loan officer tells you that you need to payoff that debt in order to be approved. Since you have the money to pay it off, you do so. Because the date of last activity is now November 2005, the collection will show on your report until November 2012 – another additional 7 years.

Now let assume that this collection was in June 2005 and you pay it off in November 2005 to obtain the loan, this will reduce your credit score. On the other hand if this collection was in September 2005 and you pay it off in November 2005 to obtain the loan, this will actually increase your score. My point is that a collection account that is less than 6 months old and is paid off will be beneficial but if your collection account is more than 6 months old and is paid off this will be detrimental to your credit score.

You as a consumer can request copies of your credit report from the 3 credit bureaus (although it’s better to get a collective report from all three in one which I can help you with) and dispute information that is incorrect. Incorrect information can be corrected or removed but correct information (good or bad) usually stays on the report for the period allowed. Only the credit grantor (lender/bank) or credit bureau can remove correct information.

If you find incorrect information on your report, contact the credit grantor obtain an explanation, have them corrected and ask them to contact all three credit bureaus and correct that information on your report. After this you should also contact all three credit with a letter with documented proof of the error on your report and ask them to remove this information. The credit bureaus by law have to respond to your letter and request. Depending on your case they might approve or deny your request but they have to respond to your letter. Following are the addresses for all three credit bureaus.

Trans Union
PO Box 4000
Chester, PA 19022
866-887-2673
http://www.transunion.com/

Experian
PO Box 2002
Allen, TX 75013
888-397-3742
http://www.experian.com/

Equifax Credit
PO Box 740241
Atlanta, GA 30374
800-685-1111
http://www.equifax.com/

label: Business & Finance
sentence:
Title: Why would Kahlua (the liqueur) run a sweepstakes only for homeowners? Isn't it poor advertising, and elitist?
Question: Their $20,000 Home Makeover Sweepstakes has no cash option, and the winner must own a home! About 5 states don't/won't allow this, and I suspect it's because it's unfairly limiting. Why would this company limit this form of advertising when homeownership is hardly a requisite for drinking Kahlua? Do they only care if well-off people are customers?
Answer: Target Marketing

Although they do run numerous contest and givaways for various reasons, something like this is to reach a target market. It is a quick and effective way to have homeowners willing give up their information for later use in a marketing campaign. This is also done with many other products that range from baby items, to beer sponsored events towards college age people. 

It is all about the data and finding a way to to increase the number of drinkers/people buying your product.

label: Education & Reference
sentence:
Question: How does the weather affect jobs in Georgia?
Answer: Summers can get very hot for outdoor jobs, particularly on bad air quality days.  

Spring and Fall are pretty moderate.

Snow storms, ice storms, and sometimes a threat of a snow storm will cause school closings and many offices to shut down for minimal amounts of snow.  

Due to the inconsistency of bad winter weather, local governments do not have the equipment to get the bulk of the roads in good shape when a bad storm hits.  Fortunately it gets back above freezing often during the winter there so there typically aren't any long term affects.  

The biggest exception would be large power outages from bad ice storms (lines down from broken tree limbs) that have lasted over a week in some areas in the last few years.  That does not however happen that often.

Question: What are current assets?
Answer: Assets are anything which the firm owns or has title to.Firms may have fixed assets which are long-term assets - plant, machinery and equipment, but they also have assets which can be realised (cashed-in) quickly(in accounting terms-less than a year).\n\nThe current assets are therefore ones that can be quickly realised and change frequently. The main current assets are stock, debtors and cash.

label: Science & Mathematics
sentence:
Title: How would you solve this?
Question: Here's the problem...

1/4 (5b + 11) = 19
Answer: It's pretty straightforward, actually.  Start by multiplying both sides by 4, leaving you with:

5b + 11 = 19 * 4 = 76

Subtract 11 from both sides:

5b = 76 - 11 = 65

Finally, divide by 5:

b = 65 / 5 = 13

...and there is your answer.

label: Science & Mathematics
sentence:
Question: how many milliliters are in a megaliter?
Answer: 1 mL (millileter) = 1 E-3 Liters

1 ML (MegaLiter) = 1 E6 Liters

1 E6 / 1 E-3 = 1 E9,
So there are 1 E9 mL per 1 ML, or
1,000,000,000 mL / ML.

sentence:
Title: When should i test?
Question: When should i test?
ok here is my story. i had my period in spetember from the 22-24th which was lighter than normal, in october i had it on the 24th which was four days late and only lasted one day. i haven't had a period this month yet but i have been tired all the time, been getting headaches, the skina round my nipples has gotten really dark, my breast are tender to the touch expecially around the nipples, i have been sick to my stomach everyday for the last couple of weeks i am trying to figure out when my period should come this month and when i should take a pregnancy test....can anyone help me? serious answers please!!!!
Answer: You could test now if you want, but I would wait until Thursday, 11/24.  Also, go ahead and make the Dr's appointment.  I would worry about the last period you had.  It sounds to me like maybe you really didn't have one.  Maybe you only had some spotting.  You may very well be getting to 8 weeks of pregnancy.  

I am not a doctor so I can't be sure.  You can do an over the counter test.  Buy one that has two tests in it so you can take one tonight and then one on Thursday.  If you test positive, you will know.  If negative, you will know to retest on Thursday.  

If you period does not start by this weekend, you know that something is definitely wrong.  You will already have a doctor's appointment made for potentially next week and you will know soon what is going on with your body!

Good luck!

label: Education & Reference
sentence:
Question: What are the similarities of Modulation and Multiplexing?
Answer: They are both ways of putting information on a bigger pipe.

For modulation, you modulate a carrier frequency with a signal.

Multiplexing involves taking multiple signals and placing them on the same baseband to carry them.

That isn't much of a similarity, though.  I guess the other one would be that you can have either digital or analog modulation and you can have either digital or analog (FDM) multiplexing.
